title: Unlike PC, monopolist lowers price to sell more

content.question: One difference between a firm in a perfectly competitive market and an unregulated monopoly is that the

choices.label: perfectly competitive firm can increase the quantity it sells at the market price, whereas the monopoly must lower its price to sell more
perfectly competitive firm sells differentiated products, whereas the monopoly sells a homogeneous product
price elasticity of demand for a monopoly is much higher than that for a perfectly competitive firm
monopolist seeks to maximize profits, whereas the perfectly competitive firm maximizes revenues
monopolist can never change a price, whereas the perfect competitor can

content.answer: perfectly competitive firm can increase the quantity it sells at the market price, whereas the monopoly must lower its price to sell more
